p: We fitted parameters to the epidemiological surveillance data from Bangui estimating R 0 equal to 1.03 (95% CI: 1.02–1.04) and birth rate equal to 1.59 (95% CI: 1.19–1.99). The monthly number of rabid dogs predicted in the city of Bangui ranges from zero to a few tens ( Fig 4A), consistently with previous observations [ 18]. Wavelet analysis [ 69] was used to identify the periodicity of the numerical trajectories in Bangui and compare them with the estimates obtained from surveillance data in the city [ 18]. Numerically predicted epidemic waves in Bangui are characterized by a full spectrum of periodicities with the highest probability reached for the empirically estimated period of 89 months ( Fig 4B). The distribution of the number of cases periodicity is obtained through wavelet analysis. Its peak is at 92 months. Additional numerical results are provided in the S1 Text.
